result.execSummary:
The defendant Equan Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Restitution is set at $0 (zero).

Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 5 years initial confinement in this case.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 93 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Seek and maintain full time employment.
Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with victim Marie H. and co-actor Antoine Pettis.

Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.  No positive results.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order has been electronically transmitted to DOC. jj

Filed, signed Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order.  
It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.
It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 02, Judge Childs. jj

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Equan Taylor in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 9 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 6 years with credit for 93 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with victim Marie H. and co-actor Antoine Pettis.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*Restitution is set at $0 (zero).

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 5 years initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.    
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Order to Produce for Sentencing Hearing on August 10, 2015 @ 1:30 pm received and filed
Memo from Asst. District Atty. James Griffin dated July 24, 2015 along with copies of letters and CD/DVD.

Defendant Equan Taylor in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Defendant Equan Taylor in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Equan Taylor in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Corut grants State's motion for modification of bail.  Defendant has $500.00 cash posted; needs to post an additional $7,000.00 for release.  All bail conditions remain the same.  Scheduling conference held.  Case set for final pretrial on 7-16-15, 8:30 and  Jury trial scheduled for 08-10-2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Equan Taylor in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea hearing scheduled for 05-18-2015 at 08:30 am.

Violation Report received and filed with court.
Scheduling conference on March 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Equan Taylor in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for James C. Griffin for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.   COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Equan Taylor in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Ron Dague for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
